alert.note: Alert for Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 7:48PM CDT until July 12 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Ripley affecting Payne County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Ripley. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Places along the Cimarron River valley in Payne County are briefly flooded. Agricultural lands and oil wells located near the channel are isolated by water in cutoff channels along the river valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 13.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Tuesday morning at 800 AM CDT.
